post.body: Thank you! Good night :-)
Like the new background! The colours work really well.
Thanks for checking again. It does sound like a dodgy script - I'll try to find it when I'm more awake.
My favourite meal? Hmm. Probably shepherds pie served with carrots and cabbage. Not very exciting I know LOL
That should be plan not pan LOL
Glad to hear it was useful. Do you pan to publish your research? I'm sure it would be really popular.
It was a good idea to put it on your blog, there might other people tracing your family who will see it and make contact.
What an a amazing story! I think it's always worth replying to old messages, the person will often respond with useful info.
I've lost a few of my own ancestors there LOL Looking forward to your tweets too.
If you still have the original images, maybe keep this bg for the Xmas period but change the wording to 'now open'.
I saw a documentary about trial by ordeal. Apparently, it was seem as more humane than the blood feuds it replaced.
The evidence was so flimsy, it seems ludicrous now, but then it must have been terrifying to be accused.
Whereabouts in England where your lot from? I ask because mine are from east Anglia and Notts which had a big Puritan community.
Me too! It must have been a terrible time to live, especially for women. What with war and witchhunts - I'm glad to be here now.
Mine stayed in England, but apparently they disapproved of music, dancing and ankles, so they might be in for a shock.
I have some crazy Puritans too - I often wonder what they'd make of their descendants LOL And lots of country vicars.
That's true. Mine aren't the most exciting bunch, but they fascinate me, because they are mine. I do have a pirate though.
I have a list too LOL And started out hoping I'd be related to x, y and z, but it turned out I wasn't.
Scary - ye gads yes, Who'd want to be related to him LOL
I'm not surprised, it would be a wonderful thing LOL
I suspect the LNU and UNK are actually the ancestors of Greta Garbo.
So good in fact, we'd find the surnames of all those poor women who never had theirs recorded.
And documented to nth degree. Heck, we'd probably know what they had on their cornflakes.
Yes, we'd have our families back to the 15th century before anyone else had opened a box of cornflakes. LOL
LOL I love that idea. We'd be like the genealogical Breakfast Club.
Same here. At 6am, no one phones, or needs me to do anything for them, and it's so peaceful.
It's always the way LOL There aren't any distractions at that time of the morning.
Listening to a genealogy podcast http://twurl.nl/as1y6i
Reading 25,000 Historical Historical Book Titles Now Free Online http://twurl.nl/p663dk #genealogy
7 Social Networks for Family Historians http://ff.im/-jaEV
Anyone got any recommendations for social networks for genealogy and family history? #genealogy
Blogged about twitter for #genealogy http://twurl.nl/0lcyn3 Any tips you'd like to add?
Our cat has just come in from his morning ablutions and is absolutely drenched. Don't think he'll be straying far from the fire now.
Reading about Butch Cassidy's Geordie roots http://twurl.nl/non5jv
Good morning :-) We've had some wild, windy weather here overnight, seems to have clamed down now though.
Good morning :-) Off to make a cup of coffee to wake myself up - I could have happily stayed in bed this morning.
Spent 2 hours writing a blog post, then accidentally hit the back button and lost it :-( That'll teach me to use the save button.
RT @Lord Matt Did you know that the UK gave out grants for digitising old documents? http://tinyurl.com/725gke
Must go and sort out my recycling, I think they pick it up tomorrow.
RT @itgeniaus Access over 6,000 maps of Scotland here http://www.nls.uk/maps/inde...
